Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • Console
  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    Console is a controller of the Game

    Console is characterized by :

    • A number of test
    • A mode of selection
    • A size of combination
    • A choice to determine in run()
    • A mode of development to display or not the combination of IA
    • A boolean victory to determine end of the game
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Geoffrey

      Builder Console.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void challenger​(Entity player1, Entity player2, int index)
      Challenger is a function to launch defense of player2 then launch attack of player 1 and launch a comparator of sign Display a list of signs And launch isEqual
      char comparator​(int num1, int num2)
      comparator is a simple function to compare num1 with num2
      java.lang.String comparatorSigns​(Entity player1, Entity player2)
      comparatorSigns launch comparator on each row to compares the 2 combination
      void CreateGame()
      createGame checked if user select restart with the same mode initializes victory to false and request isVictory()
      void defender​(Entity player1, Entity player2, int index)
      Defender is a function to launch defense of player1 then launch attack of player 2 and launch a comparator of sign launch an update of player2 Display a list of signs And launch isEqual
      void displayEndMenu()
      Display the menu of the end of game
      void displaySelectMode()
      Display the menu of mode selection
      void duel​(Entity player1, Entity player2, Entity player3, Entity player4, int index)
      duel launches a function challenger with player 1 and 2 then if there is no winner launches defender
      void game​(Entity playerAttack, Entity computerDefense, Entity playerDefense, Entity computerAttack)
      Game loops the selected game mode by the number of test or stop is victory is true
      void isEqual​(java.lang.String result, java.lang.String entity, int turn)
      isEqual passes victory to true and display victory if result equals = for each row
      void isVictory​(Entity computerDefense)
      isVictory display combination of Entity if mode select equals 1 and victory is false
      void run()
      run create the game, and request a selectEndMenu loop if choose is different from 0
      void selectEndMenu()
      SelectEndMenu request a choice 0 : Stop the game. 1 : Restart with the same mode. 2 : Change the mode

    • Constructor Detail

      • Console

        public Console​(int nbCombination,
               boolean modeDev,
               int nbTest)
        Builder Console.

        when building a Console object, we define the size of combination the number of test and if the mode of development is activate

        Parameters:
        nbCombination - the size of combination.
        modeDev - the mode of development.
        nbTest - the number of test
        See Also:
        nbCombination, modeDev, nbTest

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        run create the game, and request a selectEndMenu loop if choose is different from 0
        See Also:
        choice, CreateGame()

      • selectEndMenu

        public void selectEndMenu()
        SelectEndMenu request a choice
        • 0 : Stop the game.
        • 1 : Restart with the same mode.
        • 2 : Change the mode
        See Also:
        choice, displayEndMenu()

      • displayEndMenu

        public void displayEndMenu()
        Display the menu of the end of game

      • CreateGame

        public void CreateGame()
        createGame checked if user select restart with the same mode initializes victory to false and request isVictory()
        See Also:
        choice, modeSelect, nbCombination, victory, game(Entity, Entity, Entity, Entity), isVictory(Entity)

      • isVictory

        public void isVictory​(Entity computerDefense)
        isVictory display combination of Entity if mode select equals 1 and victory is false
        Parameters:
        computerDefense - ComputerDefense is an Entity to be displayed

      • game

        public void game​(Entity playerAttack,
                 Entity computerDefense,
                 Entity playerDefense,
                 Entity computerAttack)
        Game loops the selected game mode by the number of test or stop is victory is true
        Parameters:
        playerAttack - it's an Entity realizing the attack of challenger
        computerDefense - it's an Entity realizing the defense of challenger
        playerDefense - it's an Entity realizing the defense of defender
        computerAttack - it's an Entity realizing the attack of defender
        See Also:
        nbTest, victory, modeSelect, challenger(Entity, Entity, int), defender(Entity, Entity, int), duel(Entity, Entity, Entity, Entity, int)

      • displaySelectMode

        public void displaySelectMode()
        Display the menu of mode selection

      • challenger

        public void challenger​(Entity player1,
                       Entity player2,
                       int index)
        Challenger is a function to launch defense of player2 then launch attack of player 1 and launch a comparator of sign Display a list of signs And launch isEqual
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is the attacker (often it's the player IRL)
        player2 - player2 is the defense (often it's the IA)
        index - index is a turn of game
        See Also:
        modeDev, comparatorSigns(Entity, Entity), Entity

      • isEqual

        public void isEqual​(java.lang.String result,
                    java.lang.String entity,
                    int turn)
        isEqual passes victory to true and display victory if result equals = for each row
        Parameters:
        result - result is a string of sign
        entity - entity is a name od entity attacker
        turn - turn is a number of turns

      • comparatorSigns

        public java.lang.String comparatorSigns​(Entity player1,
                                        Entity player2)
        comparatorSigns launch comparator on each row to compares the 2 combination
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is a entity to be compared
        player2 - player2 is a entity reference
        Returns:
        a string of sign
        See Also:
        nbCombination, comparator(int, int), Entity.combination, Entity

      • defender

        public void defender​(Entity player1,
                     Entity player2,
                     int index)
        Defender is a function to launch defense of player1 then launch attack of player 2 and launch a comparator of sign launch an update of player2 Display a list of signs And launch isEqual
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is the defense (often it's the player IRL)
        player2 - player2 is the attacker (often it's the IA)
        index - index represent the number of iteration not to raise twice the defense
        See Also:
        comparatorSigns(Entity, Entity), IA.update(String), Entity

      • duel

        public void duel​(Entity player1,
                 Entity player2,
                 Entity player3,
                 Entity player4,
                 int index)
        duel launches a function challenger with player 1 and 2 then if there is no winner launches defender
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is the attacker to challenger (often it's the player IRL)
        player2 - player2 is the defense to challenger (often it's the IA)
        player3 - player2 is the defense to defender (often it's the player IRL)
        player4 - player4 is the attacker to defender (often it's the IA)
        index - index represent the number of iteration not to raise twice the defense
        See Also:
        victory, challenger(Entity, Entity, int), defender(Entity, Entity, int)

      • comparator

        public char comparator​(int num1,
                       int num2)
        comparator is a simple function to compare num1 with num2
        Parameters:
        num1 - num1 is a number to be compared
        num2 - num2 is a number reference
        Returns:
        a char with a sign (+ or - or =)
